model_answer: The events that most directly enabled the capability to generate a course on sustainable innovation were (B) and (C). These events involved the development of an AI-first Sana Assistant that could integrate with company apps, record and transcribe meetings, and provide relevant answers quickly. Additionally, the assistant's ability to automatically generate course-level content or quick summaries further enhanced its capability to create educational resources.

The most important events that led to the capability of receiving context-triggered nudges and learning inside tools like Slack and Salesforce were:

A) Event 6: The assistant automates assigning and rolling out courses with due dates and builds an indexed, searchable institutional knowledge base (shown by auto-assignment pop-up and personalized course dashboards). This event helped in creating a centralized repository of knowledge that can be easily accessed and used by employees.

B) Event 2: The system connects company apps and records/transcribes meetings so conversations become queryable, enabling contextual retrieval across tools. This event allowed for better integration and collaboration across different tools, making it easier to access relevant information at the right time.

C) Event 5: Multiplayer editing and AI image generation for brand-consistent visuals (e.g., the blue, furry character). While this event contributed to the visual consistency of the platform, it is not directly related to the capability of receiving context-triggered nudges and learning.

D) Event 1: The AI-first assistant that starts with search and consolidates knowledge across tools, shown by integrated app icons and “Institutional knowledge with Sana” on mobile. This event was the foundation for building the AI-powered assistant that can understand natural language queries and provide relevant
